pros: Mainly working with one client the whole time and can schedule many activities to keep them occupied
cons: No one to really cover if you are sick. And if there is coverage, they tend to irritate the client. Since you are working at the clients home. You are usually alone and the support from the supervisor isn't there.

pros: You're working with usually 1 to 2 clients in their homes.
cons: If you're ever sick, it's difficult to have someone cover. There's a high turn over rate due to some employees who do not know how to deal with the clients.
advice_to_mgmt: Needs better training and support for the caregivers.
